intro: Columbea imbricata var. densa, commonly known as the dense columbea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of tubular, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
